description of attribute: probability or confidence level that event occured (bet. 0 and 1)
rating or importance of the event (between 0 and 1). can be used by automated methods to denote a metric.
event type (e.g. 'fl: flare' or 'ar: activeregion')
date when voevent entry was imported into knowledge base
unique internal id of voevent entry
name of archivist (internal. user should leave blank)
url of voevent entry (internal. user should leave blank)
coordinate system type (choose between utc-hgs-topo [heliographics stonyhurst]; utc-hpr-topo [helioprojective]; utc-hgc-topo[heliographic carrington]; utc-hcr-topo[helio-centric radial])
units of coordinates (e.g. "deg, deg" for utc-hgs-top0)
time when event ends (e.g. 2004-02-14t02:00:01)
time when event starts (e.g. 2004-02-14t02:00:01)
useful for reporting events before they are complete (e.g. 2004-02-14t02:00:01)
coordinate 1 of mean location of event
coordinate 2 of mean location of event
coordinate 3 of mean location of event (optional. suitable for use with stereo secchi events)
url to an image/intensity map
url to files which contain masks (e.g. binary masks) of region of interest.
peak time of a flare (e.g. '2003-02-12t23:03:01')
uncertainty in coord1 of the mean location of the event.
uncertainty in coord2 of the mean location of the event.
whether the spatial extent of the event is wholly contained within the data set ('t' or 'f').
whether the temporal duration of the event is wholly contained within the data set ('t' or 'f').
a boolean flag to indicate that the event is for testing purposes ('t' or 'f')
description of the event
contact information of feature recognition method (frm)
date when feature recognition method (frm) was run (e.g. 2004-02-15t02:00:01)
whether a human identified the event ("t" or "f")

values of parameters (e.g. "threshold=0.1")
version number of automated feature recognition method (put age if human. just kidding. in this case put 1.0)
url to webpage containing information about the feature recognition method
the specific id of this event/feature assigned by the feature recognition method
name of observatory (e.g. soho)
name of channel of the instrument (e.g. "g band")
name of instrument (e.g. "sot")
mean wavelength (preferably in angstroms)
unit of obs_meanwavel (preferably "angstroms")
